abstract: Chef and cookbook author Julio Rodriguez of the Bronx shares romance and love underlying the Caribbean cuisine he prepares at home for Dolores Batista, his partner of 27 years; one of couple's favorite meals is chicken fricassee, dish they shared when they met on a steamy summer night in 1988 (Series: Summer Love).
lead_paragraph: A three-week summer romance ended when Dolores Batista told Julio Rodriguez she didn’t date nightclub managers. It took 10 years for them to get back together, but they haven’t been apart since.

headline.main: She Wooed Him With Stew. Now He Does the Cooking.
headline.print_headline: She Wooed Him With Stew. Now He Does the Cooking.

snippet: A three-week summer romance ended when Dolores Batista told Julio Rodriguez she didn’t date nightclub managers. It took 10 years for them to get back together, but they haven’t been apart since.
